clues.title: The Cipher Note
clues.description: A folded slip of paper bearing a sequence of symbols that repeat at irregular intervals. The ink is fresh — no more than six hours old.

clues.title: Cobblestone Carving
clues.description: A shallow glyph scratched into the cobblestone near the body. It matches the final symbol on the cipher note precisely.

clues.title: Hermetic Primer Fragment
clues.description: A torn page from what appears to be an initiation manual for the Hermetic Order of the Grey Dawn. The symbols match those on the cipher note.

clues.title: Distinctive Typeface
clues.description: The cipher note was printed, not handwritten. The typeface is unusual — a Continental Gothic used by only a handful of London printers.

clues.title: Graves's Confession
clues.description: Inspector Graves admits, reluctantly, that Scotland Yard received an identical cipher three weeks ago — and buried it. Someone above him gave the order.

clues.title: Occultist's Calling Card
clues.description: A business card for one 'Professor Aldous Vane — Consulting Spiritualist'. Found near the body, it seems damning — but Vane was in Edinburgh at the time of the murder.
